title: Divider
summary: Divider creates visual and semantic separation between content.
preamble:
Dividers helps organize information by creating clear boundaries between sections, groups, or items. They are commonly used in layouts like forms, lists, menus, or dashboards.

By default, divider has the same semantic meaning as the `<hr>` html element, which represents a thematic break. For example, a shift of topic within a section.

columns.title: Colors
columns.content: The color of the divider line can be set to a color token.

columns.title: Spacing
columns.content: Spacing around the divider can be controlled using the `size` attribute. By changing the size it changes the spacing around the hr not hte visual representation of the line itelf.

overview.title: Usage
overview.section-content:
Use dividers to support visual hierarchy when headings or spacing alone aren’t sufficient, such as between groups of menu items.

By default dividers have a semantic meaning in the browser but it can be marked as presentational using `role="presentation"` .

dolist.text: Keep dividers semantic for content breaks, presentational for visual separation.
